reviewText: I love watching the untouchables movies, They are great and always getting the bad guys. And they have no fear. And I got a great detective collection of movies at a great price.

As is the case with the other DVDs in this series this next installment is of excellent quality both in audio and video.  Robert Stack shines as the great Eliot Ness, crime fighter of the 1930's.  I am hoping that the final Season 4 will also be released to complete this series.  The packaging of the videos is top notch and you will not be disappointed in these videos.

How can I find fault with Ness and his crew? Answer is...I can't.
I now have all the Untouchables that have been released by Paramount.
Lets hurry up and release some more so I can buy em up!
Amazons excellent and speedy service only adds to the joy of owning the Untouchables!

Felicitaciones por la segunda parte de la tercera temporada de los Intocables.
Espero que para el proximo ao salga la cuarta y ultima temporada de los intocables.
Felicitaciones para los editores y todos los que participaron en el lanzamiento de este producto.

ANOTHER GREAT CHAPTER IN THE BEST TV CRIME SHOW EVER MADE. ROBERT STACK IS SO AMAZING IN THIS IS DOES NOT EVEN LOOK LIKE ACTING. MOVIE QUALITY ON T.V. IF YOU HAVE NEVER SEEN IT YOUR MISSING SOMETHING SPECIAL. MIKE JACOBSEN  9-12-2009
Nov 10....2009 is the release date for Untouchables  Season 3  Vol 2.....this leaves only season 4 to go, let's hope that will happen in 2010.

Retro television shows have never done particularly well unless they were set in the Old West. Shows set in the 20's, 30's, 40's, etc, any era outside of the one in which they aired have never lasted long except in three major exceptions - Happy Days, Laverne & Shirley, and The Untouchables.

The Untouchables succeeded for a number of reasons. First, the veil that had been on the Mafia for a number of years was slowly but surely being peeled off due to gangland killings and the fame of gangsters such as Al Capone, Bugsy Siegel, Dutch Schultz, Lucky Luciano, and others. Even before the Godfather and its outstanding first sequel, the public had a fascination and curiosity with the mob. So take some true events, ture characters, heavily fictionalize them with Hollywood gloss and pathos, and you get a very successful show that made a star out of Robert Stack and brought new fame to a Treasury agent named Eliot Ness.

The Untouchables' collection should not have been split up into multiple sections. That's greed, pure and simple. But the lure of this show - its great characters, performances, grit and intelligence will draw buyers even though they know they're being ripped off. Stack's Ness is one of the best alltime detectives - fearless, relentless, and absolutely ruthless with the bad guys. The supporting casts were always excellent, and Bruce Gordon brough the right amount of humor and menace to Frank Nitti, Capone's chief lieutenant.

The Untouchables - Season Three, Volume 2 is not untouchable, but it is irresistable.
mt best one yet
The mob is upset that Elliot Ness and the Untouchables are on their trail. Best crime series ever.
very good.

Each season of the Untouchables is more exiting than the last.  Old actors that you have not seen in years chosen to fit the parts perfectly.  The shows are very dramatic and the action never stops.  Excellent purchase from an excellent site.  No problems with ordering and fast delivery.  Amazon is the
only site I will order from, they are the best, and trustworthy.  You get what you order.

I've always liked the Untouchables, so my opinion is biased. However, it's interesting to be able to watch all the nuances and "tough guy" behaviors that Robert Stack performs in his role as Elliot Ness.

As the others in this series, this was a delight to watch. Robert Stack was born to be Eliot Ness in this series. Good old fashioned stories. From historical stories I've read about the period, many appear to be based on real people.
The best show of it's kind ever !  Laid the groundwork for what came later .... ie "Casino" , "Goodfellas', " Bronx-Tale" , " The Godfather" saga etc. ...  all 4 seasons should not be missed !
a great show from the past that shows how things were done back then and learn what needs to be done.

This was definitely a well produced historical series.  Robert Stack as Eliot Ness was a good choice.  This show depicted on how brutal life was if you got caught up in the world of crime.  This is part two of season three.  A good one to own.

I grew up with the Untouchables so I can only say that I absolutely love The Untouchables no matter what season it is. My only complaint is that each season is divided into two parts. But, in those days writers were better, television being fairly new still, there was so much material per season I guess, to sell the season in it's entirety might be too much and cost to  much. That said, time for season 4 1 & 2.
I really love seeing these old episodes, again. It is really good acting, plots, and revisiting all the now famous legendary actors and actresses when they were starting out, wow. Great entertainment
Item was as promised. I love this series. the gangsters , the 1930-prices and of course the clothes. Elliott Ness is the man. Item was shipped quickly.

The one series that demonstrate a boundary-breaking vision on the design and build of crime-TV-drama. As such an example for all producers who are challenged to innovate.
I could not find an aspect I did not appreciate. From the cast to the haunting, unforgettable voice of the narrator it represents stunning quality.

I hope all seasons will be re-released
I loved the series and grew up watching it. I have always been interested in the crime sprees and criminals of the 20's and 30's. I would recommend it to all cop show fans.
Price is a premium , but the show is worth it!  Episodes are still fresh today, since I never watched them as a teen.  They are better than the junk currently made!
I LOVE THE UNTOUCHABLES SO I AM COLLECTING ALL OF THEM. IF YOU LIKED THE OLD TIME SHOWS BUY ALL OF THESE.

i always enjoyed a walk down memory lane fine tv watching
at its best.in black and white very fine entertainment.

I have all available seasons, and they are good television.  This series has not lost anything over the years. The acting is crisp, the dialog sharp, and the action is plentiful. Since these episodes are filmed in black and white starting at the end of the 1950's, there is no unnecessary gore associated with the violence that is incorporated in them. Plenty of good stories and characters for all tastes. Besides the Untouchables themselves, the mobsters are all well-acted. Bruce Gordon is sensational as Frank Nitti. Guest stars are always a surprise, and you can see them before they became famous. Each DVD is very good and plays great.

Even pacing myself slowly, I have gradually watched through season 3 and am ready for the last season. Please release the final batch of episodes soon, CBS.  The quality of the remastering is impressive in season 3, volume 2.

These DVDs are great. They're remastered and the sound is a LOT better. The picture resolution is about as good as it can get, even on my big screen TV. Came on time and in perfect condition. I'm still waiting for Season 4 to come out.

What happened to season 4?
I waited for so long to have this collection that I can't believe they will not release the remaining of the series. Put everything together and release it as one volume. At least you can walk out of it clean, whoever is responsible for it. But don't just leave your job unfinished. It doesn't sound like Elliot Ness.
I love the mob series it wasn't on cable so I purchase it on amazon it was one of the best purchases of my life back in the day gangsta flick.

The only thing better than this whole series, so far, would be the release of SEASON 4.  Come on --- it has been over a year since the last release. This show is extremely engaging.  Nobody can watch just one.  Show or volume or season, nobody can watch just one.  It is THAT GOOD!  Wattsamatta Paramount - ya yellahhhh?

The television programs produced in the 60's were better than the "crap" produced today where sitcom actors sit on a couch, crack jokes, and go nowhere.  The Untouchables is an action series filmed in black and white which enabled using old 1930's film footage and mixing with the 1960's production.  This puts the viewer back in the 1930's time frame.  This series was "well done".
IT HAS BEEN AWHILE SINCE SEASON 3. Give the series The Untouchables what they deserve. Make this series complete; give us season 4 Paramount. This was and still is a great series.
